intro: Eriophyllum caespitosum var. achilleoides, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and features narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
